Variables.Name: enabled
Variables.Description: enable snapping for floating windows

Variables.Name: window_gap
Variables.Description: minimum gap in pixels between windows before snapping

Variables.Name: monitor_gap
Variables.Description: minimum gap in pixels between window and monitor edges before snapping

Variables.Name: border_overlap
Variables.Description: if true, windows snap such that only one border's worth of space is between them

Variables.Name: respect_gaps
Variables.Description: if true, snapping will respect gaps between windows(set in general:gaps_in)

Variables.Name: border_size
Variables.Description: size of the border around windows

Variables.Name: gaps_in
Variables.Description: gaps between windows, also supports css style gaps (top, right, bottom, left -> 5,10,15,20)

Variables.Name: gaps_out
Variables.Description: gaps between windows and monitor edges, also supports css style gaps (top, right, bottom, left -> 5,10,15,20)

Variables.Name: float_gaps
Variables.Description: gaps between windows and monitor edges for floating windows, also supports css style gaps (top, right, bottom, left -> 5 10 15 20). -1 means default

Variables.Name: gaps_workspaces
Variables.Description: gaps between workspaces. Stacks with gaps_out.

Variables.Name: col.inactive_border
Variables.Description: border color for inactive windows

Variables.Name: col.active_border
Variables.Description: border color for the active window

Variables.Name: col.nogroup_border
Variables.Description: inactive border color for window that cannot be added to a group (see denywindowfromgroup dispatcher)

Variables.Name: col.nogroup_border_active
Variables.Description: active border color for window that cannot be added to a group

Variables.Name: layout
Variables.Description: which layout to use. [dwindle/master/scrolling/monocle]

Variables.Name: no_focus_fallback
Variables.Description: if true, will not fall back to the next available window when moving focus in a direction where no window was found

Variables.Name: resize_on_border
Variables.Description: enables resizing windows by clicking and dragging on borders and gaps

Variables.Name: extend_border_grab_area
Variables.Description: extends the area around the border where you can click and drag on, only used when general:resize_on_border is on.

Variables.Name: hover_icon_on_border
Variables.Description: show a cursor icon when hovering over borders, only used when general:resize_on_border is on.

Variables.Name: allow_tearing
Variables.Description: master switch for allowing tearing to occur. See the Tearing page.

Variables.Name: resize_corner
Variables.Description: force floating windows to use a specific corner when being resized (1-4 going clockwise from top left, 0 to disable)

Variables.Name: modal_parent_blocking
Variables.Description: whether parent windows of modals will be interactive

Variables.Name: locale
Variables.Description: overrides the system locale (e.g. en_US, es)

Variables.Name: autogenerated
Variables.Description: Whether this configuration was autogenerated

Variables.Name: enabled
Variables.Description: enable kawase window background blur

Variables.Name: size
Variables.Description: blur size (distance)

Variables.Name: passes
Variables.Description: the amount of passes to perform

Variables.Name: ignore_opacity
Variables.Description: make the blur layer ignore the opacity of the window

Variables.Name: new_optimizations
Variables.Description: whether to enable further optimizations to the blur. Recommended to leave on, as it will massively improve performance.

Variables.Name: xray
Variables.Description: if enabled, floating windows will ignore tiled windows in their blur. Only available if new_optimizations is true. Will reduce overhead on floating blur significantly.

Variables.Name: noise
Variables.Description: how much noise to apply. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: contrast
Variables.Description: contrast modulation for blur. [0.0 - 2.0]

Variables.Name: brightness
Variables.Description: brightness modulation for blur. [0.0 - 2.0]

Variables.Name: vibrancy
Variables.Description: Increase saturation of blurred colors. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: vibrancy_darkness
Variables.Description: How strong the effect of vibrancy is on dark areas . [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: special
Variables.Description: whether to blur behind the special workspace (note: expensive)

Variables.Name: popups
Variables.Description: whether to blur popups (e.g. right-click menus)

Variables.Name: popups_ignorealpha
Variables.Description: works like ignore_alpha in layer rules. If pixel opacity is below set value, will not blur. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: input_methods
Variables.Description: whether to blur input methods (e.g. fcitx5)

Variables.Name: input_methods_ignorealpha
Variables.Description: works like ignore_alpha in layer rules. If pixel opacity is below set value, will not blur. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: enabled
Variables.Description: enable drop shadows on windows

Variables.Name: range
Variables.Description: Shadow range ("size") in layout px

Variables.Name: render_power
Variables.Description: in what power to render the falloff (more power, the faster the falloff) [1 - 4]

Variables.Name: sharp
Variables.Description: if enabled, will make the shadows sharp, akin to an infinite render power

Variables.Name: ignore_window
Variables.Description: if true, the shadow will not be rendered behind the window itself, only around it.

Variables.Name: color
Variables.Description: shadow's color. Alpha dictates shadow's opacity.

Variables.Name: color_inactive
Variables.Description: inactive shadow color. (if not set, will fall back to color)

Variables.Name: offset
Variables.Description: shadow's rendering offset.

Variables.Name: scale
Variables.Description: shadow's scale. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: rounding
Variables.Description: rounded corners' radius (in layout px)

Variables.Name: rounding_power
Variables.Description: adjusts the curve used for rounding corners, larger is smoother, 2.0 is a circle, 4.0 is a squircle, 1.0 is a triangular corner. [1.0 - 10.0]

Variables.Name: active_opacity
Variables.Description: opacity of active windows. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: inactive_opacity
Variables.Description: opacity of inactive windows. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: fullscreen_opacity
Variables.Description: opacity of fullscreen windows. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: dim_modal
Variables.Description: enables dimming of parents of modal windows

Variables.Name: dim_inactive
Variables.Description: enables dimming of inactive windows

Variables.Name: dim_strength
Variables.Description: how much inactive windows should be dimmed [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: dim_special
Variables.Description: how much to dim the rest of the screen by when a special workspace is open. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: dim_around
Variables.Description: how much the dim_around window rule should dim by. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: screen_shader
Variables.Description: a path to a custom shader to be applied at the end of rendering. See examples/screenShader.frag for an example.

Variables.Name: border_part_of_window
Variables.Description: whether the window border should be a part of the window

Variables.Name: enabled
Variables.Description: enable animations

Variables.Name: workspace_wraparound
Variables.Description: enable workspace wraparound, causing directional workspace animations to animate as if the first and last workspaces were adjacent

Variables.Name: disable_while_typing
Variables.Description: Disable the touchpad while typing.

Variables.Name: natural_scroll
Variables.Description: Inverts scrolling direction. When enabled, scrolling moves content directly, rather than manipulating a scrollbar.

Variables.Name: scroll_factor
Variables.Description: Multiplier applied to the amount of scroll movement.

Variables.Name: middle_button_emulation
Variables.Description: Sending LMB and RMB simultaneously will be interpreted as a middle click. This disables any touchpad area that would normally send a middle click based on location. libinput#middle-button-emulation

Variables.Name: tap_button_map
Variables.Description: Sets the tap button mapping for touchpad button emulation. Can be one of lrm (default) or lmr (Left, Middle, Right Buttons). [lrm/lmr]

Variables.Name: clickfinger_behavior
Variables.Description: Button presses with 1, 2, or 3 fingers will be mapped to LMB, RMB, and MMB respectively. This disables interpretation of clicks based on location on the touchpad. libinput#clickfinger-behavior

Variables.Name: tap-to-click
Variables.Description: Tapping on the touchpad with 1, 2, or 3 fingers will send LMB, RMB, and MMB respectively.

Variables.Name: drag_lock
Variables.Description: When enabled, lifting the finger off while dragging will not drop the dragged item. 0 -> disabled, 1 -> enabled with timeout, 2 -> enabled sticky. libinput#tap-and-drag

Variables.Name: tap-and-drag
Variables.Description: Sets the tap and drag mode for the touchpad

Variables.Name: flip_x
Variables.Description: inverts the horizontal movement of the touchpad

Variables.Name: flip_y
Variables.Description: inverts the vertical movement of the touchpad

Variables.Name: drag_3fg
Variables.Description: enables three finger drag, 0 -> disabled, 1 -> 3 fingers, 2 -> 4 fingers libinput#drag-3fg

Variables.Name: transform
Variables.Description: Transform the input from touchdevices. The possible transformations are the same as those of the monitors. -1 means it's unset.

Variables.Name: output
Variables.Description: The monitor to bind touch devices. The default is auto-detection. To stop auto-detection, use an empty string or the "[[Empty]]" value.

Variables.Name: enabled
Variables.Description: Whether input is enabled for touch devices.

Variables.Name: share_states
Variables.Description: Unify key down states and modifier states with other keyboards. 0 -> no, 1 -> yes, 2 -> yes unless IME client

Variables.Name: release_pressed_on_close
Variables.Description: Release all pressed keys by virtual keyboard on close.

Variables.Name: transform
Variables.Description: transform the input from tablets. The possible transformations are the same as those of the monitors. -1 means it's unset.

Variables.Name: output
Variables.Description: the monitor to bind tablets. Can be current or a monitor name. Leave empty to map across all monitors.

Variables.Name: region_position
Variables.Description: position of the mapped region in monitor layout relative to the top left corner of the bound monitor or all monitors.

Variables.Name: absolute_region_position
Variables.Description: whether to treat the region_position as an absolute position in monitor layout. Only applies when output is empty.

Variables.Name: region_size
Variables.Description: size of the mapped region. When this variable is set, tablet input will be mapped to the region. [0, 0] or invalid size means unset.

Variables.Name: relative_input
Variables.Description: whether the input should be relative

Variables.Name: left_handed
Variables.Description: if enabled, the tablet will be rotated 180 degrees

Variables.Name: active_area_size
Variables.Description: size of tablet's active area in mm

Variables.Name: active_area_position
Variables.Description: position of the active area in mm

Variables.Name: kb_model
Variables.Description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter. See the note below.

Variables.Name: kb_layout
Variables.Description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter

Variables.Name: kb_variant
Variables.Description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter

Variables.Name: kb_options
Variables.Description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter

Variables.Name: kb_rules
Variables.Description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter

Variables.Name: kb_file
Variables.Description: If you prefer, you can use a path to your custom .xkb file.

Variables.Name: numlock_by_default
Variables.Description: Engage numlock by default.

Variables.Name: resolve_binds_by_sym
Variables.Description: Determines how keybinds act when multiple layouts are used. If false, keybinds will always act as if the first specified layout is active. If true, keybinds specified by symbols are activated when you type the respective symbol with the current layout.

Variables.Name: repeat_rate
Variables.Description: The repeat rate for held-down keys, in repeats per second.

Variables.Name: repeat_delay
Variables.Description: Delay before a held-down key is repeated, in milliseconds.

Variables.Name: sensitivity
Variables.Description: Sets the mouse input sensitivity. Value is clamped to the range -1.0 to 1.0. libinput#pointer-acceleration

Variables.Name: accel_profile
Variables.Description: Sets the cursor acceleration profile. Can be one of adaptive, flat. Can also be custom, see below. Leave empty to use libinput's default mode for your input device. libinput#pointer-acceleration [adaptive/flat/custom]

Variables.Name: force_no_accel
Variables.Description: Force no cursor acceleration. This bypasses most of your pointer settings to get as raw of a signal as possible. Enabling this is not recommended due to potential cursor desynchronization.

Variables.Name: rotation
Variables.Description: Sets the rotation of a device in degrees clockwise off the logical neutral position. Value is clamped to the range 0 to 359.

Variables.Name: left_handed
Variables.Description: Switches RMB and LMB

Variables.Name: scroll_points
Variables.Description: Sets the scroll acceleration profile, when accel_profile is set to custom. Has to be in the form <step> <points>. Leave empty to have a flat scroll curve.

Variables.Name: scroll_method
Variables.Description: Sets the scroll method. Can be one of 2fg (2 fingers), edge, on_button_down, no_scroll. libinput#scrolling [2fg/edge/on_button_down/no_scroll]

Variables.Name: scroll_button
Variables.Description: Sets the scroll button. Has to be an int, cannot be a string. Check wev if you have any doubts regarding the ID. 0 means default.

Variables.Name: scroll_button_lock
Variables.Description: If the scroll button lock is enabled, the button does not need to be held down. Pressing and releasing the button toggles the button lock, which logically holds the button down or releases it. While the button is logically held down, motion events are converted to scroll events.

Variables.Name: scroll_factor
Variables.Description: Multiplier added to scroll movement for external mice. Note that there is a separate setting for touchpad scroll_factor.

Variables.Name: natural_scroll
Variables.Description: Inverts scrolling direction. When enabled, scrolling moves content directly, rather than manipulating a scrollbar.

Variables.Name: follow_mouse
Variables.Description: Specify if and how cursor movement should affect window focus. See the note below. [0/1/2/3]

Variables.Name: follow_mouse_threshold
Variables.Description: The smallest distance in logical pixels the mouse needs to travel for the window under it to get focused. Works only with follow_mouse = 1.

Variables.Name: focus_on_close
Variables.Description: Controls the window focus behavior when a window is closed. When set to 0, focus will shift to the next window candidate. When set to 1, focus will shift to the window under the cursor. [0/1]

Variables.Name: mouse_refocus
Variables.Description: If disabled, mouse focus won't switch to the hovered window unless the mouse crosses a window boundary when follow_mouse=1.

Variables.Name: float_switch_override_focus
Variables.Description: If enabled (1 or 2), focus will change to the window under the cursor when changing from tiled-to-floating and vice versa. If 2, focus will also follow mouse on float-to-float switches.

Variables.Name: special_fallthrough
Variables.Description: if enabled, having only floating windows in the special workspace will not block focusing windows in the regular workspace.

Variables.Name: off_window_axis_events
Variables.Description: Handles axis events around (gaps/border for tiled, dragarea/border for floated) a focused window. 0 ignores axis events 1 sends out-of-bound coordinates 2 fakes pointer coordinates to the closest point inside the window 3 warps the cursor to the closest point inside the window

Variables.Name: emulate_discrete_scroll
Variables.Description: Emulates discrete scrolling from high resolution scrolling events. 0 disables it, 1 enables handling of non-standard events only, and 2 force enables all scroll wheel events to be handled

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_distance
Variables.Description: in px, the distance of the touchpad gesture

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_touch
Variables.Description: enable workspace swiping from the edge of a touchscreen

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_invert
Variables.Description: invert the direction (touchpad only)

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_touch_invert
Variables.Description: invert the direction (touchscreen only)

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_min_speed_to_force
Variables.Description: minimum speed in px per timepoint to force the change ignoring cancel_ratio. Setting to 0 will disable this mechanic.

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_cancel_ratio
Variables.Description: how much the swipe has to proceed in order to commence it. (0.7 -> if > 0.7 * distance, switch, if less, revert) [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_create_new
Variables.Description: whether a swipe right on the last workspace should create a new one.

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_direction_lock
Variables.Description: if enabled, switching direction will be locked when you swipe past the direction_lock_threshold (touchpad only).

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_direction_lock_threshold
Variables.Description: in px, the distance to swipe before direction lock activates (touchpad only).

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_forever
Variables.Description: if enabled, swiping will not clamp at the neighboring workspaces but continue to the further ones.

Variables.Name: workspace_swipe_use_r
Variables.Description: if enabled, swiping will use the r prefix instead of the m prefix for finding workspaces.

Variables.Name: close_max_timeout
Variables.Description: the timeout for a window to close when using a 1:1 gesture, in ms

Variables.Name: enabled
Variables.Description: enables groupbars

Variables.Name: font_family
Variables.Description: font used to display groupbar titles, use misc:font_family if not specified

Variables.Name: font_size
Variables.Description: font size of groupbar title

Variables.Name: font_weight_active
Variables.Description: font weight of active groupbar title

Variables.Name: font_weight_inactive
Variables.Description: font weight of inactive groupbar title

Variables.Name: gradients
Variables.Description: enables gradients

Variables.Name: height
Variables.Description: height of the groupbar

Variables.Name: indicator_gap
Variables.Description: height of gap between groupbar indicator and title

Variables.Name: indicator_height
Variables.Description: height of the groupbar indicator

Variables.Name: stacked
Variables.Description: render the groupbar as a vertical stack

Variables.Name: priority
Variables.Description: sets the decoration priority for groupbars

Variables.Name: render_titles
Variables.Description: whether to render titles in the group bar decoration

Variables.Name: text_offset
Variables.Description: adjust vertical position for titles

Variables.Name: text_padding
Variables.Description: set horizontal padding for titles

Variables.Name: scrolling
Variables.Description: whether scrolling in the groupbar changes group active window

Variables.Name: rounding
Variables.Description: how much to round the indicator

Variables.Name: rounding_power
Variables.Description: adjusts the curve used for rounding groupbar corners, larger is smoother, 2.0 is a circle, 4.0 is a squircle, 1.0 is a triangular corner. [1.0 - 10.0]

Variables.Name: gradient_rounding
Variables.Description: how much to round the gradients

Variables.Name: gradient_rounding_power
Variables.Description: adjusts the curve used for rounding gradient corners, larger is smoother, 2.0 is a circle, 4.0 is a squircle, 1.0 is a triangular corner. [1.0 - 10.0]

Variables.Name: round_only_edges
Variables.Description: round only the indicator edges of the entire groupbar

Variables.Name: gradient_round_only_edges
Variables.Description: round only the gradient edges of the entire groupbar

Variables.Name: text_color
Variables.Description: color for window titles in the groupbar

Variables.Name: text_color_inactive
Variables.Description: color for inactive windows' titles in the groupbar (if unset, defaults to text_color)

Variables.Name: text_color_locked_active
Variables.Description: color for the active window's title in a locked group (if unset, defaults to text_color)

Variables.Name: text_color_locked_inactive
Variables.Description: color for inactive windows' titles in locked groups (if unset, defaults to text_color_inactive)

Variables.Name: col.active
Variables.Description: active group bar background color

Variables.Name: col.inactive
Variables.Description: inactive (out of focus) group bar background color

Variables.Name: col.locked_active
Variables.Description: active locked group bar background color

Variables.Name: col.locked_inactive
Variables.Description: inactive locked group bar background color

Variables.Name: gaps_in
Variables.Description: gap size between gradients

Variables.Name: gaps_out
Variables.Description: gap size between gradients and window

Variables.Name: keep_upper_gap
Variables.Description: add or remove upper gap

Variables.Name: blur
Variables.Description: applies blur to the groupbar indicators and gradients

Variables.Name: auto_group
Variables.Description: whether new windows will be automatically grouped into the focused unlocked group. Note: if you want to disable auto_group only for specific windows, use the "group barred" window rule instead.

Variables.Name: insert_after_current
Variables.Description: whether new windows in a group spawn after current or at group tail

Variables.Name: focus_removed_window
Variables.Description: whether Hyprland should focus on the window that has just been moved out of the group

Variables.Name: drag_into_group
Variables.Description: whether dragging a window into a unlocked group will merge them. Options: 0 (disabled), 1 (enabled), 2 (only when dragging into the groupbar)

Variables.Name: merge_groups_on_drag
Variables.Description: whether window groups can be dragged into other groups

Variables.Name: merge_groups_on_groupbar
Variables.Description: whether one group will be merged with another when dragged into its groupbar

Variables.Name: merge_floated_into_tiled_on_groupbar
Variables.Description: whether dragging a floating window into a tiled window groupbar will merge them

Variables.Name: group_on_movetoworkspace
Variables.Description: whether using movetoworkspace[silent] will merge the window into the workspace's solitary unlocked group

Variables.Name: col.border_active
Variables.Description: active group border color

Variables.Name: col.border_inactive
Variables.Description: inactive (out of focus) group border color

Variables.Name: col.border_locked_active
Variables.Description: active locked group border color

Variables.Name: col.border_locked_inactive
Variables.Description: inactive locked group border color

Variables.Name: disable_hyprland_logo
Variables.Description: disables the random Hyprland logo / anime girl background. :(

Variables.Name: disable_splash_rendering
Variables.Description: disables the Hyprland splash rendering. (requires a monitor reload to take effect)

Variables.Name: disable_scale_notification
Variables.Description: disables notification popup when a monitor fails to set a suitable scale

Variables.Name: col.splash
Variables.Description: Changes the color of the splash text (requires a monitor reload to take effect).

Variables.Name: font_family
Variables.Description: Set the global default font to render the text including debug fps/notification, config error messages and etc., selected from system fonts.

Variables.Name: splash_font_family
Variables.Description: Changes the font used to render the splash text, selected from system fonts (requires a monitor reload to take effect).

Variables.Name: force_default_wallpaper
Variables.Description: Enforce any of the 3 default wallpapers. Setting this to 0 or 1 disables the anime background. -1 means "random". [-1/0/1/2]

Variables.Name: vfr
Variables.Description: controls the VFR status of Hyprland. Heavily recommended to leave enabled to conserve resources.

Variables.Name: vrr
Variables.Description: controls the VRR (Adaptive Sync) of your monitors. 0 - off, 1 - on, 2 - fullscreen only, 3 - fullscreen with video or game content type [0/1/2/3]

Variables.Name: mouse_move_enables_dpms
Variables.Description: If DPMS is set to off, wake up the monitors if the mouse moves.

Variables.Name: key_press_enables_dpms
Variables.Description: If DPMS is set to off, wake up the monitors if a key is pressed.

Variables.Name: name_vk_after_proc
Variables.Description: Name virtual keyboards after the processes that create them. E.g. /usr/bin/fcitx5 will have hl-virtual-keyboard-fcitx5.

Variables.Name: always_follow_on_dnd
Variables.Description: Will make mouse focus follow the mouse when drag and dropping. Recommended to leave it enabled, especially for people using focus follows mouse at 0.

Variables.Name: layers_hog_keyboard_focus
Variables.Description: If true, will make keyboard-interactive layers keep their focus on mouse move (e.g. wofi, bemenu)

Variables.Name: animate_manual_resizes
Variables.Description: If true, will animate manual window resizes/moves

Variables.Name: animate_mouse_windowdragging
Variables.Description: If true, will animate windows being dragged by mouse, note that this can cause weird behavior on some curves

Variables.Name: disable_autoreload
Variables.Description: If true, the config will not reload automatically on save, and instead needs to be reloaded with hyprctl reload. Might save on battery.

Variables.Name: enable_swallow
Variables.Description: Enable window swallowing

Variables.Name: swallow_regex
Variables.Description: The class regex to be used for windows that should be swallowed (usually, a terminal). To know more about the list of regex which can be used use this cheatsheet.

Variables.Name: swallow_exception_regex
Variables.Description: The title regex to be used for windows that should not be swallowed by the windows specified in swallow_regex  (e.g. wev). The regex is matched against the parent (e.g. Kitty) window's title on the assumption that it changes to whatever process it's running.

Variables.Name: focus_on_activate
Variables.Description: Whether Hyprland should focus an app that requests to be focused (an activate request)

Variables.Name: mouse_move_focuses_monitor
Variables.Description: Whether mouse moving into a different monitor should focus it

Variables.Name: allow_session_lock_restore
Variables.Description: if true, will allow you to restart a lockscreen app in case it crashes

Variables.Name: session_lock_xray
Variables.Description: if true, keep rendering workspaces below your lockscreen

Variables.Name: background_color
Variables.Description: change the background color. (requires enabled disable_hyprland_logo)

Variables.Name: close_special_on_empty
Variables.Description: close the special workspace if the last window is removed

Variables.Name: on_focus_under_fullscreen
Variables.Description: if there is a fullscreen or maximized window, decide whether a tiled window requested to focus should replace it, stay behind or disable the fullscreen/maximized state. 0 - ignore focus request (keep focus on fullscreen window), 1 - takes over, 2 - unfullscreen/unmaximize [0/1/2]

Variables.Name: exit_window_retains_fullscreen
Variables.Description: if true, closing a fullscreen window makes the next focused window fullscreen

Variables.Name: initial_workspace_tracking
Variables.Description: if enabled, windows will open on the workspace they were invoked on. 0 - disabled, 1 - single-shot, 2 - persistent (all children too)

Variables.Name: middle_click_paste
Variables.Description: whether to enable middle-click-paste (aka primary selection)

Variables.Name: render_unfocused_fps
Variables.Description: the maximum limit for render_unfocused windows' fps in the background (see also Window-Rules - render_unfocused)

Variables.Name: disable_xdg_env_checks
Variables.Description: disable the warning if XDG environment is externally managed

Variables.Name: disable_hyprland_qtutils_check
Variables.Description: disable the warning if hyprland-qtutils is not installed

Variables.Name: lockdead_screen_delay
Variables.Description: delay after which the "lockdead" screen will appear in case a lockscreen app fails to cover all the outputs (5 seconds max)

Variables.Name: enable_anr_dialog
Variables.Description: whether to enable the ANR (app not responding) dialog when your apps hang

Variables.Name: anr_missed_pings
Variables.Description: number of missed pings before showing the ANR dialog

Variables.Name: size_limits_tiled
Variables.Description: whether to apply min_size and max_size rules to tiled windows

Variables.Name: disable_watchdog_warning
Variables.Description: whether to disable the warning about not using start-hyprland

Variables.Name: single_window_aspect_ratio
Variables.Description: whenever only a single window is shown on a screen, add padding so that it conforms to the specified aspect ratio. A value like 4 3 on a 16:9 screen will make it a 4:3 window in the middle with padding to the sides.

Variables.Name: single_window_aspect_ratio_tolerance
Variables.Description: sets a tolerance for single_window_aspect_ratio, so that if the padding that would have been added is smaller than the specified fraction of the height or width of the screen, it will not attempt to adjust the window size [0 - 1]

Variables.Name: pass_mouse_when_bound
Variables.Description: if disabled, will not pass the mouse events to apps / dragging windows around if a keybind has been triggered.

Variables.Name: scroll_event_delay
Variables.Description: in ms, how many ms to wait after a scroll event to allow passing another one for the binds.

Variables.Name: workspace_back_and_forth
Variables.Description: If enabled, an attempt to switch to the currently focused workspace will instead switch to the previous workspace. Akin to i3's auto_back_and_forth.

Variables.Name: hide_special_on_workspace_change
Variables.Description: If enabled, changing the active workspace (including to itself) will hide the special workspace on the monitor where the newly active workspace resides.

Variables.Name: allow_workspace_cycles
Variables.Description: If enabled, workspaces don't forget their previous workspace, so cycles can be created by switching to the first workspace in a sequence, then endlessly going to the previous workspace.

Variables.Name: workspace_center_on
Variables.Description: Whether switching workspaces should center the cursor on the workspace (0) or on the last active window for that workspace (1)

Variables.Name: focus_preferred_method
Variables.Description: sets the preferred focus finding method when using focuswindow/movewindow/etc with a direction. 0 - history (recent have priority), 1 - length (longer shared edges have priority)

Variables.Name: ignore_group_lock
Variables.Description: If enabled, dispatchers like moveintogroup, moveoutofgroup and movewindoworgroup will ignore lock per group.

Variables.Name: movefocus_cycles_fullscreen
Variables.Description: If enabled, when on a fullscreen window, movefocus will cycle fullscreen, if not, it will move the focus in a direction.

Variables.Name: movefocus_cycles_groupfirst
Variables.Description: If enabled, when in a grouped window, movefocus will cycle windows in the groups first, then at each ends of tabs, it'll move on to other windows/groups

Variables.Name: disable_keybind_grabbing
Variables.Description: If enabled, apps that request keybinds to be disabled (e.g. VMs) will not be able to do so.

Variables.Name: allow_pin_fullscreen
Variables.Description: If enabled, Allow fullscreen to pinned windows, and restore their pinned status afterwards

Variables.Name: drag_threshold
Variables.Description: Movement threshold in pixels for window dragging and c/g bind flags. 0 to disable and grab on mousedown.

Variables.Name: enabled
Variables.Description: allow running applications using X11

Variables.Name: use_nearest_neighbor
Variables.Description: uses the nearest neighbor filtering for xwayland apps, making them pixelated rather than blurry

Variables.Name: force_zero_scaling
Variables.Description: forces a scale of 1 on xwayland windows on scaled displays.

Variables.Name: create_abstract_socket
Variables.Description: Create the abstract Unix domain socket for XWayland connections. (XWayland restart is required for changes to take effect; Linux only)

Variables.Name: nvidia_anti_flicker
Variables.Description: reduces flickering on nvidia at the cost of possible frame drops on lower-end GPUs. On non-nvidia, this is ignored.

Variables.Name: direct_scanout
Variables.Description: Enables direct scanout. Direct scanout attempts to reduce lag when there is only one fullscreen application on a screen (e.g. game). It is also recommended to set this to false if the fullscreen application shows graphical glitches. 0 - off, 1 - on, 2 - auto (on with content type 'game')

Variables.Name: expand_undersized_textures
Variables.Description: Whether to expand undersized textures along the edge, or rather stretch the entire texture.

Variables.Name: xp_mode
Variables.Description: Disables back buffer and bottom layer rendering.

Variables.Name: ctm_animation
Variables.Description: Whether to enable a fade animation for CTM changes (hyprsunset). 2 means "auto" which disables them on Nvidia.

Variables.Name: cm_fs_passthrough
Variables.Description: Passthrough color settings for fullscreen apps when possible. 0 - off, 1 - always, 2 - hdr only

Variables.Name: cm_enabled
Variables.Description: Whether the color management pipeline should be enabled or not (requires a restart of Hyprland to fully take effect)

Variables.Name: send_content_type
Variables.Description: Report content type to allow monitor profile autoswitch (may result in a black screen during the switch)

Variables.Name: cm_auto_hdr
Variables.Description: Auto-switch to HDR in fullscreen when needed. 0 - off, 1 - switch to cm, hdr, 2 - switch to cm, hdredid

Variables.Name: new_render_scheduling
Variables.Description: Automatically uses triple buffering when needed, improves FPS on underpowered devices.

Variables.Name: non_shader_cm
Variables.Description: Enable CM without shader. 0 - disable, 1 - whenever possible, 2 - DS and passthrough only, 3 - disable and ignore CM issues

Variables.Name: cm_sdr_eotf
Variables.Description: Default transfer function for displaying SDR apps. default - Use default value (Gamma 2.2), gamma22 - Treat unspecified as Gamma 2.2, gamma22force - Treat unspecified and sRGB as Gamma 2.2, srgb - Treat unspecified as sRGB

Variables.Name: invisible
Variables.Description: don't render cursors

Variables.Name: sync_gsettings_theme
Variables.Description: sync xcursor theme with gsettings, it applies cursor-theme and cursor-size on theme load to gsettings making most CSD gtk based clients use same xcursor theme and size.

Variables.Name: no_hardware_cursors
Variables.Description: disables hardware cursors. 0 - use hw cursors if possible, 1 - don't use hw cursors, 2 - auto (disable when tearing)

Variables.Name: no_break_fs_vrr
Variables.Description: disables scheduling new frames on cursor movement for fullscreen apps with VRR enabled to avoid framerate spikes (may require no_hardware_cursors = true) 0 - off, 1 - on, 2 - auto (on with content type 'game')

Variables.Name: min_refresh_rate

Variables.Name: hotspot_padding
Variables.Description: the padding, in logical px, between screen edges and the cursor

Variables.Name: inactive_timeout
Variables.Description: in seconds, after how many seconds of cursor's inactivity to hide it. Set to 0 for never.

Variables.Name: no_warps

Variables.Name: persistent_warps

Variables.Name: warp_on_change_workspace

Variables.Name: warp_on_toggle_special
Variables.Description: Move the cursor to the last focused window when toggling a special workspace. Options: 0 (Disabled), 1 (Enabled), 2 (Force - ignores cursor:no_warps option)

Variables.Name: default_monitor
Variables.Description: the name of a default monitor for the cursor to be set to on startup (see hyprctl monitors for names)

Variables.Name: zoom_factor
Variables.Description: the factor to zoom by around the cursor. Like a magnifying glass. Minimum 1.0 (meaning no zoom)

Variables.Name: zoom_rigid
Variables.Description: whether the zoom should follow the cursor rigidly (cursor is always centered if it can be) or loosely

Variables.Name: zoom_detached_camera
Variables.Description: detach the camera from the mouse when zoomed in, only ever moving the camera to keep the mouse in view when it goes past the screen edges

Variables.Name: enable_hyprcursor
Variables.Description: whether to enable hyprcursor support

Variables.Name: hide_on_key_press
Variables.Description: Hides the cursor when you press any key until the mouse is moved.

Variables.Name: hide_on_touch
Variables.Description: Hides the cursor when the last input was a touch input until a mouse input is done.

Variables.Name: hide_on_tablet
Variables.Description: Hides the cursor when the last input was a tablet input until a mouse input is done.

Variables.Name: use_cpu_buffer

Variables.Name: warp_back_after_non_mouse_input

Variables.Name: zoom_disable_aa

Variables.Name: no_update_news

Variables.Name: no_donation_nag

Variables.Name: enforce_permissions
Variables.Description: whether to enable permission control.

Variables.Name: prefer_hdr

Variables.Name: overlay
Variables.Description: print the debug performance overlay. Disable VFR for accurate results.

Variables.Name: damage_blink
Variables.Description: (epilepsy warning!) flash areas updated with damage tracking

Variables.Name: gl_debugging
Variables.Description: enables OpenGL debugging with glGetError and EGL_KHR_debug, requires a restart after changing.

Variables.Name: disable_logs
Variables.Description: disable logging to a file

Variables.Name: disable_time
Variables.Description: disables time logging

Variables.Name: damage_tracking
Variables.Description: redraw only the needed bits of the display. Do not change. (default: full - 2) monitor - 1, none - 0

Variables.Name: enable_stdout_logs
Variables.Description: enables logging to stdout

Variables.Name: manual_crash
Variables.Description: set to 1 and then back to 0 to crash Hyprland.

Variables.Name: suppress_errors
Variables.Description: if true, do not display config file parsing errors.

Variables.Name: watchdog_timeout
Variables.Description: sets the timeout in seconds for watchdog to abort processing of a signal of the main thread. Set to 0 to disable.

Variables.Name: disable_scale_checks
Variables.Description: disables verification of the scale factors. Will result in pixel alignment and rounding errors.

Variables.Name: error_limit
Variables.Description: limits the number of displayed config file parsing errors.

Variables.Name: error_position
Variables.Description: sets the position of the error bar. top - 0, bottom - 1

Variables.Name: colored_stdout_logs
Variables.Description: enables colors in the stdout logs.

Variables.Name: pass
Variables.Description: enables render pass debugging.

Variables.Name: full_cm_proto
Variables.Description: claims support for all cm proto features (requires restart)

Variables.Name: allow_small_split
Variables.Description: enable adding additional master windows in a horizontal split style

Variables.Name: special_scale_factor
Variables.Description: the scale of the special workspace windows. [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: mfact
Variables.Description: the size as a percentage of the master window, for example mfact = 0.70 would mean 70% of the screen will be the master window, and 30% the slave [0.0 - 1.0]

Variables.Name: new_status
Variables.Description: master: new window becomes master; slave: new windows are added to slave stack; inherit: inherit from focused window

Variables.Name: new_on_top
Variables.Description: whether a newly open window should be on the top of the stack

Variables.Name: new_on_active
Variables.Description: before, after: place new window relative to the focused window; none: place new window according to the value of new_on_top.

Variables.Name: orientation
Variables.Description: default placement of the master area, can be left, right, top, bottom or center

Variables.Name: slave_count_for_center_master
Variables.Description: when using orientation=center, make the master window centered only when at least this many slave windows are open. (Set 0 to always_center_master)

Variables.Name: center_master_fallback
Variables.Description: Set fallback for center master when slaves are less than slave_count_for_center_master, can be left ,right ,top ,bottom

Variables.Name: smart_resizing
Variables.Description: if enabled, resizing direction will be determined by the mouse's position on the window (nearest to which corner). Else, it is based on the window's tiling position.

Variables.Name: drop_at_cursor
Variables.Description: when enabled, dragging and dropping windows will put them at the cursor position. Otherwise, when dropped at the stack side, they will go to the top/bottom of the stack depending on new_on_top.

Variables.Name: always_keep_position
Variables.Description: whether to keep the master window in its configured position when there are no slave windows

Variables.Name: pseudotile
Variables.Description: enable pseudotiling. Pseudotiled windows retain their floating size when tiled.

Variables.Name: force_split
Variables.Description: 0 -> split follows mouse, 1 -> always split to the left (new = left or top) 2 -> always split to the right (new = right or bottom)

Variables.Name: preserve_split
Variables.Description: if enabled, the split (side/top) will not change regardless of what happens to the container.

Variables.Name: smart_split
Variables.Description: if enabled, allows a more precise control over the window split direction based on the cursor's position. The window is conceptually divided into four triangles, and cursor's triangle determines the split direction. This feature also turns on preserve_split.

Variables.Name: smart_resizing
Variables.Description: if enabled, resizing direction will be determined by the mouse's position on the window (nearest to which corner). Else, it is based on the window's tiling position.

Variables.Name: permanent_direction_override
Variables.Description: if enabled, makes the preselect direction persist until either this mode is turned off, another direction is specified, or a non-direction is specified (anything other than l,r,u/t,d/b)

Variables.Name: special_scale_factor
Variables.Description: specifies the scale factor of windows on the special workspace [0 - 1]

Variables.Name: split_width_multiplier
Variables.Description: specifies the auto-split width multiplier. Multiplying window size is useful on widescreen monitors where window W > H even after several splits.

Variables.Name: use_active_for_splits
Variables.Description: whether to prefer the active window or the mouse position for splits

Variables.Name: default_split_ratio
Variables.Description: the default split ratio on window open. 1 means even 50/50 split. [0.1 - 1.9]

Variables.Name: split_bias
Variables.Description: specifies which window will receive the split ratio. 0 -> directional (the top or left window), 1 -> the current window

Variables.Name: precise_mouse_move
Variables.Description: bindm movewindow will drop the window more precisely depending on where your mouse is.

keywords.Name: submap
keywords.Description:
Keybind submaps, also known as _modes_ or _groups_, allow you to activate a
separate set of keybinds.

For example, if you want to enter a `resize`_mode_ that allows you to resize windows with the arrow keys, you can do it like this:

```ini
# Switch to a submap called `resize`.
bind = ALT, R, submap, resize

# Start a submap called "resize".
submap = resize

# Set repeatable binds for resizing the active window.
binde = , right, resizeactive, 10 0
binde = , left, resizeactive, -10 0
binde = , up, resizeactive, 0 -10
binde = , down, resizeactive, 0 10

# Use `reset` to go back to the global submap
bind = , escape, submap, reset

# Reset the submap, which will return to the global submap
submap = reset

# Keybinds further down will be global again...

```

> [!WARNING]
> Do not forget a keybind (`escape`, in this case) to reset the keymap while inside it!
> 
> If you get stuck inside a keymap, you can use `hyprctl dispatch submap reset` to go back.
> 
> If you do not have a terminal open, tough luck buddy. You have been warned.

You can also set the same keybind to perform multiple actions, such as resize
and close the submap, like so:

```ini
bind = ALT, R, submap, resize

submap = resize

bind = , right, resizeactive, 10 0
bind = , right, submap, reset
# ...

submap = reset

```

This works because the binds are executed in the order they appear, and
assigning multiple actions per bind is possible.

You can set a keybind that will be active no matter the current submap with the submap universal bind flag.

```ini
bindu = $mainMod, K, exec, kitty

```

### Nesting

Submaps can be nested, see the following example:

```ini
bind = $mainMod, M, submap, main_submap
submap = main_submap

# ...

# nested_one
bind = , 1, submap, nested_one
submap = nested_one

# ...

bind = SHIFT, escape, submap, reset
bind =      , escape, submap, main_submap
submap = main_submap
# /nested_one

# nested_two
bind = , 2, submap, nested_two
submap = nested_two

# ...

bind = SHIFT, escape, submap, reset
bind =      , escape, submap, main_submap
submap = main_submap
# /nested_two

bind = , escape, submap, reset
submap = reset

```

### Automatically close a submap on dispatch

Submaps can be automatically closed or sent to another submap by appending `,` followed by a submap or _reset_.

```ini
bind = SUPER,a, submap, submapA

# Sets the submap to submapB after pressing a.
submap = submapA, submapB
bind = ,a,exec, someCoolThing.sh
submap = reset

# Reset submap to default after pressing a.
submap = submapB, reset
bind = ,a,exec, someOtherCoolThing.sh
submap = reset

```

### Catch-All

You can also define a keybind via the special `catchall` keyword, which
activates no matter which key is pressed.

This can be used to prevent any keys from passing to your active application
while in a submap or to exit it immediately when any unknown key is pressed:

```ini
bind = , catchall, submap, reset

```

keywords.Name: windowrule
keywords.Description:
You can set window rules to achieve different window behaviors based
on their properties.

### Syntax

Basic named rule syntax:

```ini
windowrule {
  name = apply-something
  match:class = my-window

  border_size = 10
}

```

Basic anonymous rule syntax:

```ini
windowrule = match:class my-window, border_size 10

```

Rules are split into two categories of parameters: _props_ and _effects_. Props
are the `match:` parts, which are used to determine if a window should get the
rule. Effects are what is applied.

_All_ props must match for a rule to be applied.

You can have as many props and effects per rule as you please, in any order as you please, as long as:

- there is only one of one type (e.g. specifying `match:class` twice is invalid)
- there is at least one _prop_

### Props

The supported fields for props are:

FieldArgumentDescriptionmatch:class[RegEx]Windows with `class` matching `RegEx`.match:title[RegEx]Windows with `title` matching `RegEx`.match:initial_class[RegEx]Windows with `initialClass` matching `RegEx`.match:initial_title[RegEx]Windows with `initialTitle` matching `RegEx`.match:tag[name]Windows with matching `tag`.match:xwayland[bool]Xwayland windows.match:float[bool]Floating windows.match:fullscreen[bool]Fullscreen windows.match:pin[bool]Pinned windows.match:focus[bool]Currently focused window.match:group[bool]Grouped windows.match:modal[bool]Modal windows (e.g. "Are you sure" popups)match:fullscreen_state_client[client]Windows with matching `fullscreenstate`. `client` can be `0` - none, `1` - maximize, `2` - fullscreen, `3` - maximize and fullscreen.match:fullscreen_state_internal[internal]Windows with matching `fullscreenstate`. `internal` can be `0` - none, `1` - maximize, `2` - fullscreen, `3` - maximize and fullscreen.match:workspace[workspace]Windows on matching workspace. `w` can be `id`, `name:string` or `workspace selector`.match:content[int]Windows with specified content type (none = 0, photo = 1, video = 2, game = 3)match:xdg_tag[RegEx]Match a window by its xdgTag (see `hyprctl clients` to check if it has one)

Keep in mind that you _have_ to declare at least one field, but not all.

> [!NOTE]
> To get more information about a window's class, title, XWayland status or its
> size, you can use `hyprctl clients`.

> [!NOTE]
> In the output of the `hyprctl clients` command:
> `fullscreen` refers to `fullscreen_state_internal` and
> `fullscreenClient` refers to `fullscreen_state_client`

### RegEx writing

Please note Hyprland uses [Google's RE2](https://github.com/google/re2) for parsing RegEx. This means that all operations requiring polynomial
time to compute will not work. See the [RE2 wiki](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax) for supported extensions.

If you want to _negate_ a RegEx, as in pass only when the RegEx _fails_, you can prefix it with `negative:`, e.g.: `negative:kitty`.

keywords.Name: layerrule
keywords.Description:
Some things in Wayland are not windows, but layers. That includes, for example:
app launchers, status bars, or wallpapers.

Those have specific rules, separate from windows. Their syntax is the exact same,
but they have different props and effects.

### Props

FieldArgumentDescriptionmatch:namespace[RegEx]namespace of the layer, check `hyprctl layers`.

### Effects

effectargumentdescriptionno_anim[on]Disables animations.blur[on]Enables blur for the layer.blur_popups[on]Enables blur for the popups.ignore_alpha[a]Makes blur ignore pixels with opacity of `a` or lower. `a` is float value from `0` to `1`. `a = 0` if unspecified.dim_around[on]Dims everything behind the layer.xray[on]Sets the blur xray mode for a layer. `0` for off, `1` for on, `unset` for default.animation[style]Allows you to set a specific animation style for this layer.order[n]Sets the order relative to other layers. A higher `n` means closer to the edge of the monitor. Can be negative. `n = 0` if unspecified.above_lock[0/1/2]If non-zero, renders the layer above the lockscreen when the session is locked. If set to `2`, you can interact with the layer on the lockscreen, otherwise it will only be rendered above it.no_screen_share[on]Hides the layer from screen sharing by drawing a black rectangle over it.

### Examples

```
layerrule = blur on, match:namespace waybar

layerrule {
  name = no_anim_for_selection
  no_anim = on
  match:namespace = selection
}

```

keywords.Name: workspace
keywords.Description:
RuleDescriptiontypemonitor:[m]Binds a workspace to a monitor. See [syntax](#syntax) and [Monitors](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Monitors).stringdefault:[b]Whether this workspace should be the default workspace for the given monitorboolgapsin:[x]Set the gaps between windows (equivalent to [General->gaps_in](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables#general))intgapsout:[x]Set the gaps between windows and monitor edges (equivalent to [General->gaps_out](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables#general))intbordersize:[x]Set the border size around windows (equivalent to [General->border_size](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables#general))intborder:[b]Whether to draw borders or notboolshadow:[b]Whether to draw shadows or notboolrounding:[b]Whether to draw rounded windows or notbooldecorate:[b]Whether to draw window decorations or notboolpersistent:[b]Keep this workspace alive even if empty and inactiveboolon-created-empty:[c]A command to be executed once a workspace is created empty (i.e. not created by moving a window to it). See the [command syntax](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Dispatchers#executing-with-rules)stringdefaultName:[s]A default name for the workspace.stringlayout:[s]The layout to use for this workspace.string

### Example Rules

```ini
workspace = 3, rounding:false, decorate:false
workspace = name:coding, rounding:false, decorate:false, gapsin:0, gapsout:0, border:false, monitor:DP-1
workspace = 8,bordersize:8
workspace = name:Hello, monitor:DP-1, default:true
workspace = name:gaming, monitor:desc:Chimei Innolux Corporation 0x150C, default:true
workspace = 5, on-created-empty:[float] firefox
workspace = special:scratchpad, on-created-empty:foot

```

keywords.Name: animation
keywords.Description:
Animations are declared with the `animation` keyword.

```ini
animation = NAME, ONOFF, SPEED, CURVE [,STYLE]

```

`ONOFF` use `0` to disable, `1` to enable. _Note:_ if it's `0`, you
can omit further args.

`SPEED` is the amount of ds (1ds = 100ms) the animation will take.

`CURVE` is the bezier curve name, see [curves](#curves).

`STYLE` (optional) is the animation style.

The animations are a tree. If an animation is unset, it will inherit its
parent's values. See [the animation tree](#animation-tree).

### Examples

```ini
animation = workspaces, 1, 8, default
animation = windows, 1, 10, myepiccurve, slide
animation = fade, 0

```

### Animation tree

```txt
global
   windows - styles: slide, popin, gnomed
     windowsIn - window open - styles: same as windows
     windowsOut - window close - styles: same as windows
     windowsMove - everything in between, moving, dragging, resizing.
   layers - styles: slide, popin, fade
     layersIn - layer open
     layersOut - layer close
   fade
     fadeIn - fade in for window open
     fadeOut - fade out for window close
     fadeSwitch - fade on changing activewindow and its opacity
     fadeShadow - fade on changing activewindow for shadows
     fadeDim - the easing of the dimming of inactive windows
     fadeLayers - for controlling fade on layers
       fadeLayersIn - fade in for layer open
       fadeLayersOut - fade out for layer close
     fadePopups - for controlling fade on wayland popups
       fadePopupsIn - fade in for wayland popup open
       fadePopupsOut - fade out for wayland popup close
     fadeDpms - for controlling fade when dpms is toggled
   border - for animating the border's color switch speed
   borderangle - for animating the border's gradient angle - styles: once (default), loop
   workspaces - styles: slide, slidevert, fade, slidefade, slidefadevert
     workspacesIn - styles: same as workspaces
     workspacesOut - styles: same as workspaces
     specialWorkspace - styles: same as workspaces
       specialWorkspaceIn - styles: same as workspaces
       specialWorkspaceOut - styles: same as workspaces
   zoomFactor - animates the screen zoom
   monitorAdded - monitor added zoom animation

```

> [!WARNING]
> Using the `loop` style for `borderangle` requires Hyprland to _constantly_ render new frames at a frequency equal to your screen's refresh rate (e.g. 60 times per second for a 60hz monitor), which might stress your CPU/GPU and will impact battery life. 
> This will apply even if animations are disabled or borders are not visible.

keywords.Name: bezier
keywords.Description:
Defining your own [Bzier curve](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B%C3%A9zier_curve) can be done with the `bezier` keyword:

```ini
bezier = NAME, X0, Y0, X1, Y1

```

where `NAME` is a name of your choice and `X0, Y0, X1, Y1` are the the two control points for a Cubic Bzier curve. 
A good website to design your own Bzier can be [cssportal.com](https://www.cssportal.com/css-cubic-bezier-generator/). 
If you want to instead choose from a list of pre-made Bziers, you can check out [easings.net](https://easings.net).

### Example

```ini
bezier = overshoot, 0.05, 0.9, 0.1, 1.1

```

### Extras

For animation style `popin` in `windows`, you can specify a minimum percentage
to start from. For example, the following will make the animation 80% -> 100% of
the size:

```ini
animation = windows, 1, 8, default, popin 80%

```

For animation styles `slide`, `slidevert`, `slidefade` and `slidefadevert` in `workspaces`, you can
specify a movement percentage. For example, the following will make windows move
20% of the screen width:

```ini
animation = workspaces, 1, 8, default, slidefade 20%

```

For animation style `slide` in `windows` and `layers` you can specify a forced side. 
You can choose between `top`, `bottom`, `left` or `right`.

```ini
animation = windows, 1, 8, default, slide left

```

keywords.Name: exec
keywords.Description:
You can execute a shell script on:

- startup of the compositor
- every time the config is reloaded.
- shutdown of the compositor

`exec-once = command` will execute only on launch ([support rules](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Dispatchers/#executing-with-rules))

`execr-once = command` will execute only on launch

`exec = command` will execute on each reload ([support rules](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Dispatchers/#executing-with-rules))

`execr = command` will execute on each reload

`exec-shutdown = command` will execute only on shutdown

keywords.Name: source
keywords.Description:
Use the `source` keyword to source another file. Globbing is supported

For example, in your `hyprland.conf` you can:

```ini
source = ~/.config/hypr/myColors.conf
source = ~/.config/hypr/custom/*

```

And Hyprland will enter that file and parse it like a Hyprland config.

Please note it's LINEAR. Meaning lines above the `source =` will be parsed first,
then lines inside `~/.config/hypr/myColors.conf`, then lines below.

keywords.Name: env
keywords.Description:
> [!NOTE]
> A new environment cannot be passed to already running processes. If you change / add / remove an `env = ` entry
> when Hyprland is running, only newly spawned apps will pick up the changes.

You can use the `env` keyword to set environment variables,
e.g:

```ini
env = XCURSOR_SIZE,24

```

You can also add a `d` flag if you want the env var to be exported to D-Bus
(systemd only):

```ini
envd = XCURSOR_SIZE,24

```

> [!WARNING]
> Hyprland puts the raw string to the env var. You should _not_ add quotes around
> the values.
> 
> e.g.:
> 
> ```ini
> env = QT_QPA_PLATFORM,wayland
> 
> ```
> 
> and _**NOT**_
> 
> ```ini
> env = QT_QPA_PLATFORM,"wayland"
> 
> ```

keywords.Name: monitor
keywords.Description:
The general config of a monitor looks like this:

```ini
monitor = name, resolution, position, scale

```

A common example:

```ini
monitor = DP-1, 1920x1080@144, 0x0, 1

```

This will make the monitor on `DP-1` a `1920x1080` display, at
144Hz, `0x0` off from the top left corner, with a scale of 1 (unscaled).

To list all available monitors (active and inactive):

```bash
hyprctl monitors all

```

Monitors are positioned on a virtual "layout". The `position` is the position,
in pixels, of said display in the layout. (calculated from the top-left corner)

For example:

```ini
monitor = DP-1, 1920x1080, 0x0, 1
monitor = DP-2, 1920x1080, 1920x0, 1

```

will tell Hyprland to put DP-1 on the _left_ of DP-2, while

```ini
monitor = DP-1, 1920x1080, 1920x0, 1
monitor = DP-2, 1920x1080, 0x0, 1

```

will tell Hyprland to put DP-1 on the _right_.

The `position` may contain _negative_ values, so the above example could also be
written as

```ini
monitor = DP-1, 1920x1080, 0x0, 1
monitor = DP-2, 1920x1080, -1920x0, 1

```

Hyprland uses an inverse Y cartesian system. Thus, a negative y coordinate
places a monitor higher, and a positive y coordinate will place it lower.

For example:

```ini
monitor = DP-1, 1920x1080, 0x0, 1
monitor = DP-2, 1920x1080, 0x-1080, 1

```

will tell Hyprland to put DP-2 _above_ DP-1, while

```ini
monitor = DP-1, 1920x1080, 0x0, 1
monitor = DP-2, 1920x1080, 0x1080, 1

```

will tell Hyprland to put DP-2 _below_.

> [!NOTE]
> The position is calculated with the scaled (and transformed) resolution, meaning
> if you want your 4K monitor with scale 2 to the left of your 1080p one, you'd
> use the position `1920x0` for the second screen (3840 / 2). If the monitor is
> also rotated 90 degrees (vertical), you'd use `1080x0`.

> [!WARNING]
> No monitors can overlap. This means that if your set positions make any monitors
> overlap, you will get a warning.

> [!NOTE]
> "Invalid scale" warnings will pop up if your scale does not create valid
> logical pixels. A valid scale must divide your resolution cleanly (without
> decimals). For example 1920x1080 / 1.5 = 1280x720 -> OK, but
> when / 1.4 -> 1371.4286x771.42857 -> not ok.

Leaving the name empty will define a fallback rule to use when no other rules
match.

There are a few special values for the resolutions:

- `preferred` - use the display's preferred size and refresh rate.
- `highres` - use the highest supported resolution.
- `highrr` - use the highest supported refresh rate.
- `maxwidth` - use the widest supported resolution.

Position also has a few special values:

- `auto` - let Hyprland decide on a position. By default, it places each new monitor to the right of existing ones,
    using the monitor's top left corner as the root point.
- `auto-right/left/up/down` - place the monitor to the right/left, above or below other monitors,
    also based on each monitor's top left corner as the root.
- `auto-center-right/left/up/down` - place the monitor to the right/left, above or below other monitors,
    but calculate placement from each monitor's center rather than its top left corner.

_**Please Note:**_ While specifying a monitor direction for your first monitor is allowed, this does nothing and it will
be positioned at (0,0). Also, the direction is always from the center out, so you can specify `auto-up` then `auto-left`,
but the left monitors will just be left of the origin and above the origin. You can also specify duplicate directions and
monitors will continue to go in that direction.

You can also use `auto` as a scale to let Hyprland decide on a scale for you.
These depend on the PPI of the monitor.

Recommended rule for quickly plugging in random monitors:

```ini
monitor = , preferred, auto, 1

```

This will make any monitor that was not specified with an explicit rule
automatically placed on the right of the other(s), with its preferred
resolution.

For more specific rules, you can also use the output's description (see
`hyprctl monitors` for more details). If the output of `hyprctl monitors` looks
like the following:

```yaml
Monitor eDP-1 (ID 0):
        1920x1080@60.00100 at 0x0
        description: Chimei Innolux Corporation 0x150C (eDP-1)
        make: Chimei Innolux Corporation
        model: 0x150C
        [...]

```

then the `description` value up to, but not including the portname `(eDP-1)` can
be used to specify the monitor:

```ini
monitor = desc:Chimei Innolux Corporation 0x150C, preferred, auto, 1.5

```

Remember to remove the `(portname)`!

### Custom modelines

You can set up a custom modeline by changing the resolution field to a modeline,
for example:

```ini
monitor = DP-1, modeline 1071.101 3840 3848 3880 3920 2160 2263 2271 2277 +hsync -vsync, 0x0, 1

```

### Disabling a monitor

To disable a monitor, use

```ini
monitor = name, disable

```

> [!WARNING]
> Disabling a monitor will literally remove it from the layout, moving all windows
> and workspaces to any remaining ones. If you want to disable your monitor in a
> screensaver style (just turn off the monitor) use the `dpms`[dispatcher](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Dispatchers).

keywords.Name: bind
keywords.Description:
```ini
bind = MODS, key, dispatcher, params

```

for example,

```ini
bind = SUPER_SHIFT, Q, exec, firefox

```

will bind opening Firefox to SUPER + SHIFT + Q

> [!NOTE]
> For binding keys without a modkey, leave it empty:
> 
> ```ini
> bind = , Print, exec, grim
> 
> ```

_For a complete mod list, see [Variables](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables/#variable-types)._

_The dispatcher list can be found in
[Dispatchers](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Dispatchers/#list-of-dispatchers)._

### Comma Syntax

Binds use commas as **argument separators**. The `bind` keyword expects exactly
4 arguments, so you need exactly 3 commas:

```ini
bind = MODS, key, dispatcher, params
#      1     2    3          4

```

> [!NOTE]
> Trailing commas in example configs (e.g., `bind = SUPER, Tab, cyclenext,`) indicate
> an empty `params` argument. Only include a trailing comma when the last argument
> is intentionally empty.

```ini
bind = SUPER, F, exec, firefox   # OK - 4 args
bind = , Print, exec, grim       # OK - 4 args (empty first = no modifier)
bind = SUPER, F, exec, firefox,  # NOT OK - tries to exec `firefox,` which doesn't exist
bind = SUPER, Tab, cyclenext,    # OK - 4 args (empty last arg (dispatcher needs no params))

```

> [!WARNING]
> An accidental trailing comma becomes part of the argument (e.g., `firefox,` instead
> of `firefox`). If a keybind isn't working, check for trailing commas!

keywords.Name: unbind
keywords.Description:
You can also unbind a key with the `unbind` keyword, e.g.:

```ini
unbind = SUPER, O

```

This may be useful for dynamic keybindings with `hyprctl`, e.g.:

```bash
hyprctl keyword unbind SUPER, O

```

> [!NOTE]
> In `unbind`, key is case-sensitive It must exactly match the case of the `bind` you are unbinding.
> 
> ```ini
> bind = SUPER, TAB, workspace, e+1
> unbind = SUPER, Tab # this will NOT unbind
> unbind = SUPER, TAB # this will unbind
> 
> ```

## Bind flags

`bind` supports flags in this format:

```ini
bind[flags] = ...

```

e.g.:

```ini
bindrl = MOD, KEY, exec, amongus

```

Available flags:

FlagNameDescription`l`lockedWill also work when an input inhibitor (e.g. a lockscreen) is active.`r`releaseWill trigger on release of a key.`c`clickWill trigger on release of a key or button as long as the mouse cursor stays inside `binds:drag_threshold`.`g`dragWill trigger on release of a key or button as long as the mouse cursor moves outside `binds:drag_threshold`.`o`long pressWill trigger on long press of a key.`e`repeatWill repeat when held.`n`non-consumingKey/mouse events will be passed to the active window in addition to triggering the dispatcher.`m`mouseSee the dedicated [Mouse Binds](#mouse-binds) section.`t`transparentCannot be shadowed by other binds.`i`ignore modsWill ignore modifiers.`s`separateWill arbitrarily combine keys between each mod/key, see [Keysym combos](#keysym-combos).`d`has descriptionWill allow you to write a description for your bind.`p`bypassBypasses the app's requests to inhibit keybinds.`u`submap universalWill be active no matter the submap.

Example Usage:

```ini
# Example volume button that allows press and hold, volume limited to 150%
binde = , XF86AudioRaiseVolume, exec, wpctl set-volume -l 1.5 @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SINK@ 5%+

# Example volume button that will activate even while an input inhibitor is active
bindl = , XF86AudioLowerVolume, exec, wpctl set-volume @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SINK@ 5%-

# Open wofi on first press, closes it on second
bindr = SUPER, SUPER_L, exec, pkill wofi || wofi

# Describe a bind
bindd = SUPER, Q, Open my favourite terminal, exec, kitty

# Skip player on long press and only skip 5s on normal press
bindo = SUPER, XF86AudioNext, exec, playerctl next
bind = SUPER, XF86AudioNext, exec, playerctl position +5

```
